Full API¶

This sections defines every function in the project, either public or private. It is highly recommend to use the Public API documentation instead.

See also

  • Data Structures

  • Public API

Parsing¶

makka_pakka.parsing.parse._convert_heading_name_to_type(name: str) → HeadingType¶

Converts a string heading name into its associated HeadingType value.

Parameters:

name – The name to convert into a HeadingType.

Returns:

The HeadingType of the passed name, None if invalid.

makka_pakka.parsing.parse._split_into_headings(mkpk_filepath: str) → MKPKLines¶

Splits a makka pakka code file into its headings - code, data, gadgets.

Parameters:

mkpk_filepath – The filepath to the .mkpk file to be split into headings.

Returns:

A MKPKLines object contain the raw lines from the .mkpk files.

makka_pakka.parsing.parse.parse_makka_pakka(mkpk_filepath: str) → MKPKIR¶

Parses a makka pakka code file to generate an intermediate representation object used by the processing phase.

Parameters:

mkpk_filepath – The filepath to the .mkpk file to be split into headings.

Returns:

A MKPKIR object to be used during the processing phase.

makka_pakka.parsing.parse_headings._extract_args_from_function(line: str) → List[str]¶

Extracts the args definined in a function definition line. e.g the function definition “[func_name] name age” will return [“name”, “age”].

Parameters:

line – The function definition line to extract the args from.

Returns:

A list of strings indicating the names of the function arguments.

makka_pakka.parsing.parse_headings._interpret_data_type(value: str, line: str) → Tuple[str | int, MKPKDataType]¶

Interprets data in a .mkpk file.

Parameters:

  • value – The value to interpret.

  • line – The line that the data was found in.

Returns:

A tuple containing the data as a string or int, and the MKPKDataType of the data.

Raises:

MKPKParsingError - When the data couldn’t be interpretted.

makka_pakka.parsing.parse_headings.parse_data(lines: List[str]) → List[MKPKData]¶

Packs data lines from the .mkpk file into MKPKData structures.

Parameters:

lines – A list of code lines from the .mkpk source file.

Returns:

A list of parsed MKPKData objects.

makka_pakka.parsing.parse_headings.parse_functions(lines: List[str]) → List[MKPKFunction]¶

Packs code lines from the .mkpk file into MKPKFunction strcutures.

Parameters:

lines – A list of code lines from the .mkpk source file.

Returns:

A list of parsed MKPKFunction objects.

makka_pakka.parsing.parse_headings.parse_gadgets(lines: List[str]) → List[MKPKGadget]¶

Packs gadget lines from the .mkpk file into MKPKGadget structures.

Parameters:

lines – A list of code lines from the .mkpk source file.

Returns:

A list of parsed MKPKGadget objects.

makka_pakka.parsing.parse_headings.parse_metadata(lines: List[str]) → List[MKPKMetaData]¶

Packs metadata from the .mkpk file into MKPKMetaData structures.

Parameters:

lines – A list of code lines from the .mkpk source file.

Returns:

A list of parsed MKPKMetaData objects.

class makka_pakka.parsing.detect_headings.HeadingStyle¶

Enum of heading style e.g [heading_name] is SINGLE_HEADING, [[name]] is a DOUBLE_HEADING.

class makka_pakka.parsing.detect_headings.HeadingType¶

Enum of heading type, which defines the type of code expected below, and therefore how to parse this data, e.g [[data]] is DATA, [[code]] is CODE, [[gadget]] is gadget.

makka_pakka.parsing.detect_headings._assert_valid_mkpk_name(name: str, line: str = '') → None¶

Asserts that a name used in makka pakka is valid.

Parameters:

  • name – The name to be validated.

  • line – The line that the heading is defined in, for debugging.

Raises:

MKPKNameError - When the heading name is invalid.

makka_pakka.parsing.detect_headings.detect_heading_in_line(line: str) → Tuple[HeadingStyle, str]¶

Determines if a line contains a heading, i.e [{name}] or [[{name}]]

Parameters:

line – The line of makka pakka code to detect a heading in.

Returns:

A tuple of (HeadingStyle, {heading_name}), where heading_name is “” if the type is HeadingStyle.NO_HEADING.

makka_pakka.linking.linker._assert_no_conflict_in_data_labels(lhs: MKPKIR, rhs: MKPKIR)¶

Asserts if there are conflicts in the data labels of MKPKIR objects.

makka_pakka.linking.linker._assert_no_conflict_in_functions(lhs: MKPKIR, rhs: MKPKIR)¶

Asserts if there are conflicts in the function names’ of MKPKIR objects.

makka_pakka.linking.linker._assert_no_conflict_in_gadget_addresses(lhs: MKPKIR, rhs: MKPKIR)¶

Asserts if there are conflicts in the ROP gadget memory locations of MKPKIR objects.

makka_pakka.linking.linker._combine_MKPKIRs(lhs: MKPKIR, rhs: MKPKIR) → MKPKIR¶

Combines to MKPKIR objects into one. :param lhs: The first object to combine. The metadata of this object is kept. :param rhs: The second object to combine. The metadata of this object is lost. :return: The combined MKPKIR object.

makka_pakka.linking.linker.merge_MKPKIRs(mkpkirs: List[MKPKIR]) → MKPKIR¶

Merges a list of MKPKIR objects into a single MKPKIR. The returned object is then ready to be processed. This function is intended to be called using the result of parse_with_linking. This function is responsible for several validation checks: - Function names do not conflict - Data labels do not conflit - ROPGadget memory addresses do not conflict

Parameters:

mkpkirs – The list of MKPKIR objects to be merged into one.

Returns:

A MKPKIR object with all passed objects merged into it.

makka_pakka.linking.linker.parse_link_and_merge(mkpk_filepath: str) → MKPKIR¶

Parses, links, and merges a main makka pakkka source file.

Parameters:

mkpk_filepath – The filepath the main .mkpk source file to be parsed, linked, and merged.

Returns:

A linked, and merged MKPKIR object.

makka_pakka.linking.linker.parse_with_linking(mkpk_filepath: str) → List[MKPKIR]¶

Parses a makka pakka source file, recursively linking with files found in the !link metadata directive.

Parameters:

mkpk_filepath – The makka pakka source file to parse using recursive linking.

Returns:

A list of MKPKIR objects which represent .mkpk files that have been parsed as dependencies of the main source file. The main source file will at index 0.

Remark:

Each IR object in the returned list is assigned a metadata attribute ‘link_depth’ which specifies the number of linked files between it and the main source file. A direct link from the source file will have value 1.

class makka_pakka.linking.linker_path.LinkerPath(mkpk_main_filepath: str)¶

A class to store paths to directories that the linker should search in to find linkable makka pakka files.

add_path_to_linker(dir_path: str, priority: PriorityType) → None¶

Adds a directory path to the linker paths with a specified priority.

Parameters:

  • dir_path – The path to directory to add to the linker path.

  • priority – The priority to give the new linker path.

find_mkpk_file(mkpk_filename: str) → str¶

Iterates through the stored linker paths to find a .mkpk file using its basename. If there are multiple files with the same basename in the linkable directories, then the higher priority directory path will be selected.

Parameters:

mkpk_filename – The basename of the .mkpk file. e.g “file.mkpk”.

Returns:

The resolved absolute filepath of the passed .mkpk filename, or “” if not found.

Processing¶

makka_pakka.processing.process.process_makka_pakka(ir: MKPKIR) → MKPKCode¶

Runs the processing phase of makka pakka compilation.

Parameters:

ir – The MKPKIR object which was the result of the parsing phase.

Returns:

A MKPKCode object which has been processed.

makka_pakka.processing.data_replacement._extract_data_references(code_line: str) → List[str]¶
Extracts 0 to many data references in the format ${<label>} from a line of

code.

Parameters:

code_line – The line of code to extract data references from.

Returns:

A list of string data references that were found in the code line.

makka_pakka.processing.data_replacement._extract_label_from_reference(data_reference: str) → str¶

Extracts the label from a data references, e.g if data_reference is “${apple}” then the return value would be “apple”.

Parameters:

data_reference – The data reference to extract the label from.

Returns:

The label extracted from the passed data reference.

makka_pakka.processing.data_replacement._replace_reference_with_value(code_line: str, data_reference: str, data: MKPKData) → str¶

Replaces a data reference in a code line with its archived value.

Parameters:

  • code_line – The code line to replace the data reference in.

  • data_reference – The data reference in the line to replace.

  • value – The value to replace the data reference with.

Returns:

The new code line with the replaced value.

makka_pakka.processing.data_replacement.process_data_replacement(mkpkir: MKPKIR) → MKPKIR¶

Replaces any data references in code with the corresponding data value. For example:

[[data]] num: 1

[[code]] [my_func] mov rax, ${num}

Will become:

[[code]] [my_func] mov rax, 1

Parameters:

mkpkir – The MKPKIR object to replace data references in.

Returns:

The MKPKIR object with its data replaced.

makka_pakka.processing.function_replacement._assert_correct_num_of_args(curr_func: MKPKFunction, passed_args: MKPKArgumentSet)¶

Asserts that the number arguments passed to a MKPKFunction is equal to the number of expected arguments.

makka_pakka.processing.function_replacement._get_function_by_name_or_assert(functions: List[MKPKFunction], name: str) → MKPKFunction¶
Gets a function by name or asserts a ProcessingError if the function is not

found.

Parameters:

  • functions – A list of MKPKFunction objects to search for the name in.

  • name – The function name to search for.

Returns:

The MKPKFunction object with the specified name.

Raises:

ProcessingError - When the function name is not found.

makka_pakka.processing.function_replacement._get_line_as_function_call(code_line: str) → MKPKFunctionCall | None¶

Attempts to interpret a code line as a function call.

Parameters:

code_line – The code line to interpret as a function call.

Returns:

Retruns an MKPKFunctionCall object if the line is a function call, or None if it is not.

makka_pakka.processing.function_replacement._get_ref_value_from_arguments(data_reference: str, func: MKPKFunction, args: MKPKArgumentSet, data: List[MKPKData]) → MKPKData¶

Resolves the value of a data reference using the function’s arguments.

Parameters:

  • data_reference – The data reference to resolve.

  • func – The function that the data reference was found in.

  • args – The arguments passed to the function.

  • data – The data labels defined in the program. These are used to make a reference to existing data in a function call.

Returns:

The MKPKData that the data reference should be replaced with.

Raises:

MKPKProcessingError - When the data reference couldn’t be resolved.

makka_pakka.processing.function_replacement._parse_line_as_function_call(code_line: str) → MKPKFunctionCall¶

Parses a code line as a MKPKFunctionCall.

Parameters:

code_line – The code line to interpret as a function call.

Returns:

The parsed MKPKFunctionCall object.

Raises:

MKPKProcessingError - When the line is not a function call. MKPKNameError - When a name in the function call is invalid.

makka_pakka.processing.function_replacement.process_function_replacement(mkpkir: MKPKIR) → List[str]¶

Replaces any function references with the code resolved at the reference. For example: [[code]] [main] mov rax, 1 func_1 2

[func_1] arg1 mov ecx, ${arg1}

Will become: [[code]] [main] mov rax, 1 mov ecx, 2

Parameters:

mkpkir – The MKPKIR object to replace function references in.

Returns:

A list of processed code lines, ready to be executed.

Integrating¶

makka_pakka.integrating.integrate._format_code_into_asm_function(code: MKPKCode) → MKPKCode¶

Formats the assembly code into an _start function so that it can be compiled as a standalone binary.

Parameters:

code – The MKPKCode to be formatted into an assembly function.

Returns:

The formatted MKPKCode obj.

makka_pakka.integrating.integrate._translate_mkpkdata_to_asm(data: List[MKPKData]) → List[str]¶

Translates a MKPKData object into assembly data definitions.

Parameters:

data – The MKPKData object to translate into assembly.

Returns:

A List of assembly strings, translated from the passed MKPKData.

makka_pakka.integrating.integrate._write_code_to_file(code: MKPKCode, output_filepath: str = '') → str¶

Writes makka pakka code into an output filepath.

Parameters:

  • code – The MKPKCode obj to write to file.

  • output_filepath – (Optional) The filepath to write the code to. This will be a random /tmp/{uuid} path if not specified.

Returns:

The filepath that the code was written to.

makka_pakka.integrating.integrate.integrate_makka_pakka(code: MKPKCode, output_filepath: str = '') → str¶

Runs the integrating phase of makka pakka compilation.

Parameters:

  • code – The MKPKCode object which as the result of the processing phase.

  • output_filepath – The filepath to write the integrated code to. This will be a random /tmp/{uuid} path if not specified.

Returns:

The filepath that the code was written to.

ELF Caver¶

makka_pakka.elf_caver.caver.code_caver._get_end_of_section(section: Section) → int¶

Gets the offset at the end of the passed section

Parameters:

sections – The ELF.Section object to get the final offset of.

Returns:

The offset at the end of the section.

makka_pakka.elf_caver.caver.code_caver._get_end_of_segment(segment: Segment) → int¶

Returns the offset at the end of a segment.

Parameters:

segment – The ELF.Segment object to get final offset of.

Returns:

The offset at the end of the segment.

makka_pakka.elf_caver.caver.code_caver._get_executable_segments(segments: Iterator[Segment]) → List[Segment]¶

Filters a list of segments to just those with the executable flag.

Parameters:

segments – An Iterator of ELF.Segment objects to be filtered

Returns:

A list of ELF.Segment objects with the executable flag

makka_pakka.elf_caver.caver.code_caver._get_last_section_in_segment(segment: Segment) → Section¶

Gets the last section in a segment

Parameters:

segment – The ELF.Segment object to get the last section from

Returns:

The ELF.Section object which was last in the segment.

makka_pakka.elf_caver.caver.code_caver.get_code_caves(binary: Binary) → List[Tuple[int, int]]¶

Gets the code caves from the passed binary. Returns a list of tuples in the format: (code cave offset, code cave size).

Parameters:

binary – The binary to find the code caves in

Returns:

A list of code caves in the format (code cave offset, code cave size)

makka_pakka.elf_caver.caver.file_permissions.is_executable(value: int) → bool¶

Returns true when a permission integer indicates it is executable

makka_pakka.elf_caver.caver.file_permissions.is_writable(value: int) → bool¶

Returns true when a permission integer indicates it is writable

makka_pakka.elf_caver.caver.file_permissions.permission_to_str(value: int) → str¶

Converts a permission integer into its string form.

Parameters:

value – The permission integer to convert to a permission string.

Returns:

The permission string e.g “RW” or “RX”

makka_pakka.elf_caver.formatting.print_elf.pprint_header(binary: Binary) → None¶

Prints the ELF header stdout in a readable format

makka_pakka.elf_caver.formatting.print_elf.pprint_sections(binary: Binary) → None¶

Prints the ELF sections table

makka_pakka.elf_caver.formatting.print_elf.pprint_segments(binary: Binary) → None¶

Prints the ELF segments table

makka_pakka.elf_caver.formatting.table_formatter.print_table(*columns: List[List[str]], **kwargs: Dict) → None¶

Pretty prints table data.

Parameters:

  • headers – Optional A list of the column headers in order. Length must be equal to number of data columns.

  • alignment – Optional A list indicating the desired alignment for each column. Left=’<’, Right=’>’, Centre=’^’. Length must be equal to number of data columns.

  • offset – Optional The no. leading/ trailing spaces applied to a data column. For example a right aligned entry with an offset of 1 would have 1 space before the end of the column.

  • padding – Optional The no. blank spaces to add to a column on top of the dynamically calculated size.

  • columns – Lists of strings for the column data should be passed in order as variadic arguments

For example a table containing columns for name, age would pass headers=[“Name”, “Age”] and two list arguments: the first containing the names, and the second containing the ages (as strings).

makka_pakka.elf_caver.formatting.table_formatter.table_rows_to_columns(*rows: List[List[str]])¶

Convienience function for converting table rows into table columns, the correct format for print_table

makka_pakka.elf_caver.injector.binary_injector._get_shellcode_from_nasm(nasm_filepath: str) → List[int]¶

Gets the shellcode bytes from a .nasm file

Parameters:

nasm_filepath – The filepath of the nasm file to get the shellcode from.

Returns:

A list of shellcode bytes.

makka_pakka.elf_caver.injector.binary_injector._inject_shellcode_at_offset(shellcode: List[int], target_binary: str, offset: int, output: str = '') → str¶

Injects shellcode into the binary at a given offset.

Parameters:

  • shellcode – The shellcode bytes to inject into the binary.

  • target_binary – The filepath to the binary to inject the shellcode into.

  • offset – The offset into the binary where the shellcode should be injected.

  • output – The filepath to where the patch binary should be created.

Returns:

A filepath to the output binary.

makka_pakka.elf_caver.injector.binary_injector.inject_nasm_into_binary(nasm_filepath: str, target_binary_filepath: str, output_filepath: str = '', **kwargs) → str¶

Injects a nasm source file into binary.

Parameters:

  • nasm_filepath – The filepath of the nasm file to inject.

  • target_binary_filepath – The filepath of the binary to inject into.

  • output_filepath – Optional The filepath to output the injected binary to.

  • kwargs – patch_entrypoint Whether the entrypoint of the output binary should be patched to point to the code cave. patch_exit Whether the process exit of the output binary should be patched to point to the code cave.

Returns:

The filepath to the injected binary.

Throws:
InsufficientCodeCaves -> There was not a large enough code cave in the target

binary to inject into.

MKPKInvalidParameter -> A parameter was malformed.

makka_pakka.elf_caver.injector.byte_extraction.extract_bytes(binary_filepath: str) → str¶

Extracts the bytes from a hex file and returns them as a concatenated string.

Parameters:

binary_filepath – The filepath string to the binary to extract bytes from.

Returns:

The bytes as a continuous string i.e “12 34 56…”

makka_pakka.elf_caver.injector.byte_extraction.to_little_endian_32bit(value: int) → Tuple[int, int, int, int]¶

Converts a 32-bit value to little endian byte array

makka_pakka.elf_caver.injector.compile.compile(filepath: str, target_arch: str) → List[str]¶

Compiles a .asm file

Parameters:

  • filepath – A filepath to the .asm file to be compiled

  • target_arch – The architecture target of the compilation

Returns:

A list of files created by this function

makka_pakka.elf_caver.injector.redirect_execution.change_entrypoint(target_binary: str, entrypoint: int, output: str = '')¶

Change the entrypoint of an elf64 file.

Parameters:

  • target_binary – The target binary to change the entrypoint of.

  • entrypoint – The new entrypoint to change to.

  • output – The output binary with the new entrypoint.

Returns:

The output filepath.

makka_pakka.elf_caver.injector.redirect_execution.patch_pltsec_exit(target_binary: str, inject_offset: int, output: str = '') → str¶

Patches the address of the exit functions in .plt.sec. Code at the patched address will be executed on process exit (under certain conditions). This function calculates the address using the offset of the code in the binary (this is to comply with PIE restrictions).

Parameters:

  • target_binary – The binary the patch the .plt.sec exit entries in.

  • inject_offset – The offset into the binary that will be executed on process exit.

  • output – Optional The file to save the patched binary to.

Returns:

The filepath of the patched binary.
